availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Casey County, Kentucky, carpenter. Casey County, Kentucky, native. Married to Mary Rowsey Carter in Mercer County, Kentucky, on August 9, 1837. Father of Mary Carter, Isaac Carter, Susan Carter, James Carter, Nancy Carter, John Carter, Sarah Carter, Enos Carter, Jr., and George Carter. Carpenter in Casey County, Kentucky, in 1850. Carpenter in Casey County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Casey County, District 1, p. 339A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Casey County, District 1, p. 369.
"Enos Carter (1809-1885)," Find A Grave, Memorial 74540855, accessed June 19, 2023, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/74540855.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Mercer County Marriages, Film 000191856.
